Ruqqus is now Reddit.

post.body:
I mean like nostalgic stuff like old software and other media that got bought out and morphed by woke companies into tracking infested woke pieces of the political machine. Would how would you feel about a community funded effort to buy back and clean up some of the damage done to them, whether it involves open sourcing or some other modification to better protect this kind of stuff? 

I just though of it when I realized how many open source clones exist of the game "Minecraft" that attempt to bring back the essence of the original. But lets face it, no matter how amazing some of the devs are you just can't replace something so iconic and ingrained into pop-culture. 

So I just had a random insane idea and Ruqqus seemed like just the kind of people who'd be interested; A community funded organization with the goal of buy back media that's important/ingrained in online culture and opening it into the public domain or something along those line.

It'd be easier to get rid of IP rights altogether than do this. Unfortunately that's about as likely as becoming ancap.

The fundamental problem is that such harsh ip laws are a requirement of several international organizations, which countries can't just back out of without serious implications. Banning of "Derivative works" and the like as well as ultra lengthy terms didn't used to happen in the US until the international organizations mandated it. Plus Disney is in bed with the deep state and they'll *never* stop with the Mickey Mouse curve, nor the expanding of how much control ip holders have; at this point it's not even legal to *think* about something without permission.

post.body:
I mean like nostalgic stuff like old software and other media that got bought out and morphed by woke companies into tracking infested woke pieces of the political machine. Would how would you feel about a community funded effort to buy back and clean up some of the damage done to them, whether it involves open sourcing or some other modification to better protect this kind of stuff? 

I just though of it when I realized how many open source clones exist of the game "Minecraft" that attempt to bring back the essence of the original. But lets face it, no matter how amazing some of the devs are you just can't replace something so iconic and ingrained into pop-culture. 

So I just had a random insane idea and Ruqqus seemed like just the kind of people who'd be interested; A community funded organization with the goal of buy back media that's important/ingrained in online culture and opening it into the public domain or something along those line.

post.body:
Over the last few months attitudes toward the admins have grown more and more negative as user's have started to feel that the admins are either hostile to the user base or that the admins are heavily influenced by a minority of users on Ruqqus Discord who have been known to show disdain for the base and differ from the majority of Ruqqus users in usability significant ways. 

A significant portion of the user base is feeling ignored, unappreciated, looked down upon, kept out of the loop, and as if they've been made out to be a "problem" on Ruqqus right now. Because of continuous bad PR and and the loss of the impression of impartial admins, users have engaged in protests, name calling, and speculation.

So, after making my own observations and taking feedback from users here https://ruqq.us/66j6 , I've created a concise list of Questions that users need answers to in order to continue to be supporters of the platform and steps that would need to be taken in order to restore user confidence in the dev team.

This is an opportunity for the Admins to clarify their positions and provide a degree of transparency for the significant portion of Ruqqus users who feel unwanted on the platform right now.

**Anticipation**

1. A post reply is not an official response and it is not particularly helpful for communicating your positions to the site. Having to reference users to a thread to hunt down casual responses is not helpful and it is not legitimate. This is why users keep asking you the "same questions." You need a single resource to direct users to. As such, responses to these Questions and Demands need to all be in a single, referable post (as should all official correspondence with the community, generally). 

2. Users are not interested in the condescending, vague, dismissive, and seemingly scripted tone characteristic of interactions with captainmeta4. Users are seeking authenticity. You should respond to these Questions and Demands honestly and in your own words. We're looking for a productive dialogue.

3. Engagement from each of the admins @captainmeta4 @kek and @arkitekt

4. An official response by 11:30pm CT (12:30 ET) tomorrow.

________________

**Questions**

* *What does free speech mean to you? Why did you start a free speech platform?*

* *Do Ruqqus Admins maintain their commitment to free speech, privacy, transparency, and fairness? If so, will you continue to do so, as well as you can, even when you receive either public or private feedback against doing so?*

* *Members of the Ruqqus user base believe that admins have made decisions based on feelings and personal dislike in the past. In an effort to prevent future occurrences of this, are you willing to add objectivity to your list of commitments?*

* *Members of the Ruqqus user base feel that you are dismissive and that they no longer know your intentions for the platform. Are you willing to make a commitment to sharing intentions for the platform if and when they change? Are you willing to make a commitment to sharing the objectives of new features with the Ruqqus community?*

* *Plainly, clearly and honestly; what are your intentions for Ruqqus as a platform and what does the end product look like in terms of community organization, user demographics, and type of platform?*

* *Do you feel animosity for any portion of your user base?*

* *Do you feel that having a lower percentage of right-wing users relative to others is beneficial for Ruqqus and/or your profits?*

* *Do you value and appreciate right-wingers, those with alternative politics or “offensive” views, and users of widely criticized platforms like Voat, Poal.co, and others using Ruqqus?*

* *Would you prefer a left-wing or apolitical user base over a right-leaning user base?*

* *Reddit had an issue with brigading and you’ve attempted to implement features that make brigading more difficult on Ruqqus. When confronted with evidence of users organizing brigades and attempts to manipulate the front-page offsite, why do you refrain from penalizing them?*

* *Are you willing to make a commitment to spending more time communicating with users on Ruqqus.com than on other platforms?*

**Demands**

1. *Communicate all information relevant to regular users, guildmasters, and any other role that may be created in the future to those users through Ruqqus.com at least 24 hours prior to announcing it on offsite chat platforms.*

2.  *Stop banning people from official Ruqqus guilds and communication channels, stop kicking on-topic posts from these guilds, and reverse all previous bans from these guilds and channels.*

3.  *Delete the Ruqqus Discord server and set up an uncensored chat on an uncensored service where pro-free-speech people can participate, if an offsite chat system is needed.*

4. *Announce, discuss intention, and receive community feedback on plans for new features as posts in a designated guild prior to implementation and implement polls (for qualified users) to gauge user reception, and act accordingly. Engage in a user-centered design process.*

5.  *Explicitly state all users who have the ability to write code for Ruqqus and their privileges relative to the average Ruqqus user in the +RuqqusAdmin guild description and on the Ruqqus corporate website.*

6. *End the favoritism regarding offsite chat participants; do not prioritize their feedback and suggestions over Ruqqus user feedback and suggestions, do not post ban notices to offsite chat participants, do not give them passes or allow justification for rule-breaking that regular Ruqqus users do not get.*

7.  *Treat all users with understanding and respect across all platforms; do not participate in attempts to troll or demean Ruqqus users, stop dismissing and disparaging users for reacting to admin mistakes, and respond to user concerns.*

8. *Allow guildmasters functional autonomy over their communities and do not implement features that purposely harm the discoverability of guilds outside of opt-out user filter preferences. Particularly, end all categorization based on “offense,” end categorization applied to +All, do not shadowban uncategorized guilds, and do not self-appoint roles to change guild or user settings.*

9.  *End snap decision banning, offer 2 official warnings prior to ban, and implement a publicly viewable appeals process for banned and exiled users.*

10. *Seek to prevent such contentious community issues in the future by hiring a marketing and community relations manager and by creating a functional distinction between those who set policy and those who enforce policy.*

**Ruqqus Community**

While we await a response, please keep in mind that this is a collaborative effort between the community and the admins. As such, it might be helpful to brainstorm suggestions for ways the admits could meet the demands. 

For example;

*What alternatives to Discord could Ruqqus Admins use that would enable to participation of pro-free speech users and what terms for participation would be acceptable to you?*

*What would a good user feedback system look like to you and how could the admins implement it?*

*What do you think would be the best method to deal with spammers without compromising free speech?*

*How can we attract a larger user base without attempting to hide the majority of the user base?*

**Edit**

This is an opportunity for Ruqqus users and Ruqqus admins to begin the journey to a point of understanding, confidence, and goodwill. As such, **there will be neither name-calling nor insulting of users or admins allowed on this post thread.** Please refrain from it *all.*

  • Do you value and appreciate right-wingers, those with alternative politics or “offensive” views, and users of widely criticized platforms like Voat, Poal.co, and others using Ruqqus?

  • Would you prefer a left-wing or apolitical user base over a right-leaning user base?

  • Reddit had an issue with brigading and you’ve attempted to implement features that make brigading more difficult on Ruqqus. When confronted with evidence of users organizing brigades and attempts to manipulate the front-page offsite, why do you refrain from penalizing them?

  • Are you willing to make a commitment to spending more time communicating with users on Ruqqus.com than on other platforms?

Demands

  1. Communicate all information relevant to regular users, guildmasters, and any other role that may be created in the future to those users through Ruqqus.com at least 24 hours prior to announcing it on offsite chat platforms.

  2. Stop banning people from official Ruqqus guilds and communication channels, stop kicking on-topic posts from these guilds, and reverse all previous bans from these guilds and channels.

  3. Delete the Ruqqus Discord server and set up an uncensored chat on an uncensored service where pro-free-speech people can participate, if an offsite chat system is needed.

  4. Announce, discuss intention, and receive community feedback on plans for new features as posts in a designated guild prior to implementation and implement polls (for qualified users) to gauge user reception, and act accordingly. Engage in a user-centered design process.

  5. Explicitly state all users who have the ability to write code for Ruqqus and their privileges relative to the average Ruqqus user in the +RuqqusAdmin guild description and on the Ruqqus corporate website.

  6. End the favoritism regarding offsite chat participants; do not prioritize their feedback and suggestions over Ruqqus user feedback and suggestions, do not post ban notices to offsite chat participants, do not give them passes or allow justification for rule-breaking that regular Ruqqus users do not get.

  7. Treat all users with understanding and respect across all platforms; do not participate in attempts to troll or demean Ruqqus users, stop dismissing and disparaging users for reacting to admin mistakes, and respond to user concerns.

  8. Allow guildmasters functional autonomy over their communities and do not implement features that purposely harm the discoverability of guilds outside of opt-out user filter preferences. Particularly, end all categorization based on “offense,” end categorization applied to +All, do not shadowban uncategorized guilds, and do not self-appoint roles to change guild or user settings.

  9. End snap decision banning, offer 2 official warnings prior to ban, and implement a publicly viewable appeals process for banned and exiled users.

  10. Seek to prevent such contentious community issues in the future by hiring a marketing and community relations manager and by creating a functional distinction between those who set policy and those who enforce policy.

Ruqqus Community

While we await a response, please keep in mind that this is a collaborative effort between the community and the admins. As such, it might be helpful to brainstorm suggestions for ways the admits could meet the demands.

For example;

What alternatives to Discord could Ruqqus Admins use that would enable to participation of pro-free speech users and what terms for participation would be acceptable to you?

What would a good user feedback system look like to you and how could the admins implement it?

What do you think would be the best method to deal with spammers without compromising free speech?

How can we attract a larger user base without attempting to hide the majority of the user base?

Edit

This is an opportunity for Ruqqus users and Ruqqus admins to begin the journey to a point of understanding, confidence, and goodwill. As such, there will be neither name-calling nor insulting of users or admins allowed on this post thread. Please refrain from it all.

post.body:
Over the last few months attitudes toward the admins have grown more and more negative as user's have started to feel that the admins are either hostile to the user base or that the admins are heavily influenced by a minority of users on Ruqqus Discord who have been known to show disdain for the base and differ from the majority of Ruqqus users in usability significant ways. 

A significant portion of the user base is feeling ignored, unappreciated, looked down upon, kept out of the loop, and as if they've been made out to be a "problem" on Ruqqus right now. Because of continuous bad PR and and the loss of the impression of impartial admins, users have engaged in protests, name calling, and speculation.

So, after making my own observations and taking feedback from users here https://ruqq.us/66j6 , I've created a concise list of Questions that users need answers to in order to continue to be supporters of the platform and steps that would need to be taken in order to restore user confidence in the dev team.

This is an opportunity for the Admins to clarify their positions and provide a degree of transparency for the significant portion of Ruqqus users who feel unwanted on the platform right now.

**Anticipation**

1. A post reply is not an official response and it is not particularly helpful for communicating your positions to the site. Having to reference users to a thread to hunt down casual responses is not helpful and it is not legitimate. This is why users keep asking you the "same questions." You need a single resource to direct users to. As such, responses to these Questions and Demands need to all be in a single, referable post (as should all official correspondence with the community, generally). 

2. Users are not interested in the condescending, vague, dismissive, and seemingly scripted tone characteristic of interactions with captainmeta4. Users are seeking authenticity. You should respond to these Questions and Demands honestly and in your own words. We're looking for a productive dialogue.

3. Engagement from each of the admins @captainmeta4 @kek and @arkitekt

4. An official response by 11:30pm CT (12:30 ET) tomorrow.

________________

**Questions**

* *What does free speech mean to you? Why did you start a free speech platform?*

* *Do Ruqqus Admins maintain their commitment to free speech, privacy, transparency, and fairness? If so, will you continue to do so, as well as you can, even when you receive either public or private feedback against doing so?*

* *Members of the Ruqqus user base believe that admins have made decisions based on feelings and personal dislike in the past. In an effort to prevent future occurrences of this, are you willing to add objectivity to your list of commitments?*

* *Members of the Ruqqus user base feel that you are dismissive and that they no longer know your intentions for the platform. Are you willing to make a commitment to sharing intentions for the platform if and when they change? Are you willing to make a commitment to sharing the objectives of new features with the Ruqqus community?*

* *Plainly, clearly and honestly; what are your intentions for Ruqqus as a platform and what does the end product look like in terms of community organization, user demographics, and type of platform?*

* *Do you feel animosity for any portion of your user base?*

* *Do you feel that having a lower percentage of right-wing users relative to others is beneficial for Ruqqus and/or your profits?*

* *Do you value and appreciate right-wingers, those with alternative politics or “offensive” views, and users of widely criticized platforms like Voat, Poal.co, and others using Ruqqus?*

* *Would you prefer a left-wing or apolitical user base over a right-leaning user base?*

* *Reddit had an issue with brigading and you’ve attempted to implement features that make brigading more difficult on Ruqqus. When confronted with evidence of users organizing brigades and attempts to manipulate the front-page offsite, why do you refrain from penalizing them?*

* *Are you willing to make a commitment to spending more time communicating with users on Ruqqus.com than on other platforms?*

**Demands**

1. *Communicate all information relevant to regular users, guildmasters, and any other role that may be created in the future to those users through Ruqqus.com at least 24 hours prior to announcing it on offsite chat platforms.*

2.  *Stop banning people from official Ruqqus guilds and communication channels, stop kicking on-topic posts from these guilds, and reverse all previous bans from these guilds and channels.*

3.  *Delete the Ruqqus Discord server and set up an uncensored chat on an uncensored service where pro-free-speech people can participate, if an offsite chat system is needed.*

4. *Announce, discuss intention, and receive community feedback on plans for new features as posts in a designated guild prior to implementation and implement polls (for qualified users) to gauge user reception, and act accordingly. Engage in a user-centered design process.*

5.  *Explicitly state all users who have the ability to write code for Ruqqus and their privileges relative to the average Ruqqus user in the +RuqqusAdmin guild description and on the Ruqqus corporate website.*

6. *End the favoritism regarding offsite chat participants; do not prioritize their feedback and suggestions over Ruqqus user feedback and suggestions, do not post ban notices to offsite chat participants, do not give them passes or allow justification for rule-breaking that regular Ruqqus users do not get.*

7.  *Treat all users with understanding and respect across all platforms; do not participate in attempts to troll or demean Ruqqus users, stop dismissing and disparaging users for reacting to admin mistakes, and respond to user concerns.*

8. *Allow guildmasters functional autonomy over their communities and do not implement features that purposely harm the discoverability of guilds outside of opt-out user filter preferences. Particularly, end all categorization based on “offense,” end categorization applied to +All, do not shadowban uncategorized guilds, and do not self-appoint roles to change guild or user settings.*

9.  *End snap decision banning, offer 2 official warnings prior to ban, and implement a publicly viewable appeals process for banned and exiled users.*

10. *Seek to prevent such contentious community issues in the future by hiring a marketing and community relations manager and by creating a functional distinction between those who set policy and those who enforce policy.*

**Ruqqus Community**

While we await a response, please keep in mind that this is a collaborative effort between the community and the admins. As such, it might be helpful to brainstorm suggestions for ways the admits could meet the demands. 

For example;

*What alternatives to Discord could Ruqqus Admins use that would enable to participation of pro-free speech users and what terms for participation would be acceptable to you?*

*What would a good user feedback system look like to you and how could the admins implement it?*

*What do you think would be the best method to deal with spammers without compromising free speech?*

*How can we attract a larger user base without attempting to hide the majority of the user base?*

**Edit**

This is an opportunity for Ruqqus users and Ruqqus admins to begin the journey to a point of understanding, confidence, and goodwill. As such, **there will be neither name-calling nor insulting of users or admins allowed on this post thread.** Please refrain from it *all.*
